userreviews.userReview: This is a 'easy paced" story of three thirty-something, unmarried women who spend a summer vacation at a Florida beach house. They liken themselves to the sisterhood in the movie "Steel Magnolias". Each becomes involved in a summer romance with complications. They support each other through ups and downs and contemplate their futures from the perspective of strong women who are determined to plot their own course through life, not as trophy wives or homebodies but as independent women who follow their own heart and support the other women in their lives. Their self-named PMS Club is not what you might think. A good story, no big drama, normal summer and not the typical romance ending. I enjoyed the book, its humor and the style of writing. This is the second book I have read by this author, selected after enjoying another of her books. More are on my list now.
Best friends Is was a short light read. Three girls going to the beach to find excitement..for young adult not for me
Cute sisterhood storyLight hearted story about a friendship, pms club, the summer, and of course men. A quick read if you need a light romance to fill some time.

I enjoyed this Carolyn Brown book.... I got it because the title intrigued me. However, that is not what it stands for. I liked how it described the friendships & also that you don't choose who to love. It is a good summer read... especially since it takes place in the summer & on a beach. As all of her books, this one was just fun! I started it before I had our grandchildren for a week or I would have finished it sooner!

Fun StoryI enjoyed this book, because it explored the differences in the attitudes of men and women in relationships, beginnings and endings. It also went a bit in depth regarding social relationships between women who are very close friends and the men they chose. Another good one, Ms. Brown.

Anger to loveDixie found herself in Florida for the summer angry swearing off men. That didn't happen when she ran into the T-shirt store owner when he thought she was trying to shoplift. She ends up working for him and steals his heart away. Dixie and her PMS sisters have a bond that is unbroken and stands the tests of times. Great read and recommend to anyone.
A really funny, sweet, storyLots of laughs, a fun story, it is so like me and my friends, I couldn't believe it. I will recommend it to my friends and we will laugh about it together.

Good beach readNot overly deep or thought-provoking, but I really liked the characters and their devotion to each other. Sweet beach read that kept my interest without being overly 'sappy' or graphic.

A cute and enjoyable story about 3 teachers (and friends) that go away to Florida for summer vacation. A very quick read. Over the five years of their friendship they have started a club called The PMS club but you will have to read the book to find out what that means (it's not what you think)

True friendship3 school teachers with a deep friendship, taking a break from relationships. Not looking for love. Only a summer of fun together as best friends. Love finds them all and thru it all their friendship grows.
I want what they haveCarolyn Brown has never let me down. The ladies of the Periapt Magnolia Society are so real I can almost smell the sunshine and taste the root beer.
Loved it.Three friends go to Florida for vacations and find the loves of their life's. it's not an easy road but the find their ways in funny ways. One more great one from Carolyn.
Summer Fun, Or HeartacheHow this fun book ends is exciting. A nice change from most of Ms. Brown's books..I loved it. This book has everything you want in a love story!
Fantastic!I swore I was on the beach, making a tee shirt and playing in the surf... Love the details a the personalities of each person.
Finding Love!I love this author and I'm so glad she wrote this story in book form. She keeps me laughing and crying through out the book.
The ONE ClubThis was a wonderful book to read. I really enjoyed the characters and their different escapades that they went through. Thank you. Gailene Shearer
Another quick summer read. Not terribly good writing, but still fun.

Fun read.Fun read.First, I picked the book out of sentimentality. The author lives in a part of Oklahoma where I spent many happy summer vacations with my mother's family. Secondly, the main characters live in Conway, Arkansas, where I spent my first two years of college. Thirdly, I read the reviews which all admired her writing style. They were right. She writes in a colloquial style with great humor. I loved the breezy style and thoroughly enjoyed being exposed to the Southernisms again. I got to be down South again without having to endure the humidity. All's well that ends well, as this does without once losing its quick pace and dragging in the middle as many books do. You can't beat this book for a light read that will have you chuckling on nearly every page...

Great read until the abrupt ending. Where were the steamy scenes like in the romance novel Dixie was reading? What actually happened between her and Boone? How did the summer just...end? I feel like there was so much missing and the author just got sick of writing and decided to end it. Also, super unrealistic that Jill would stay with Paul - I'm sorry but you don't do that to your friends. Ugh! Frustrating!

Yikes. Seldom do I not finish a book or do I not want to finish a book, but this was one of them. It was just flat. The characters were not sympathetic. None of them were worth rooting for or even worth seeing to the end. It was just not a fun read. It was not really even a read that taught me anything. When one of the main characters hooked up on the beach within the first 30 pages, I thought, "Forget it. Not really going to enhance my life with fun, character development or intrgue. Done."

Please don't waste your timeI think the writer forgot about a third of the way in that she was writing about one person and expanded the 'plot' to include three persons it without developing the storyline. A very tepid read. Uninspiring, boring and unimaginative. I'm puzzled by the positive reviews written by others.

One hot summer for the PMSers clubI would give this book 3 stars only because of the humor in it. It would be a good beach read,however it certainly is not a page Turner or a book that you can't put down. The 30 something s or incurable romanticsI might enjoy it but it was not my cup of tea. I would say pass on this one.

Bit DisappointingI have,read a few books from this author and this was very mediocre, not her best. The dialogue was awkward and trite; the main characters used phrases that were dated and highly unlikely dialogue you would ever hear in the real world. I found it very distracting. The storyline was okay, but the dialogue simply killed it.
Two stars for way it endedIt was a good read but the ending didn't do it for me, it felt like Brown just okay I've had it with this story and slammed a ending on it and called it done.

Fan, Beaut, Gorg, Love a good beach read and this one belongs in my collection. Every woman deserves to be free to go on a girls weekend or longer, these ladies have confirmed that it's okay to get away for awhile and just have fun!

I thought this was just a fast read and didn't watch any TV with all the violence..A fast read ....just fair....no violence....typically what goes on in Florida...maybe the following book will have more depth....I really prefer more fun things going on...
Great escapeCarolyn Brown is awesome. My second book and I loved it as much as the first. Great girlfriend story. Love that these women are in their thirties been around the block. A must read.

Girlfriend book.Quick and easy read. The makings of a fairytale by the beach. If you need to just get away from the everyday stress of life, this will do the trick. Or if you think life has passed you by, there is still hope!
A good short story to read the character's can all be related to in real life situations. It would be nice to have a group of friends to spend the summer at the beach with!
Great summer readthis was a fun story of girlfriends going to the beach together and finding the things that they want out of life and what will make the happy.

description: Dixie Nelson arrived in Florida with a mad spell sitting on her shoulders. Her two friends Faith and Jill could flirt with the tanned and gorgeous men on the beaches all they wanted. She wasn't going to do anything but try to get over her anger and enjoy a perfect summer... one with no men allowed in her heart. Not even the good looking T-shirt painter who employed her right after he accused her of shop lifting.Boone Callahan spent all his summers in Florida, painting and selling T-shirts to the tourists. How was he supposed to know the woman running out of his shop with three tee shirts tucked under her arm wasn't trying to steal them? Or that when he hired her as part-time help she would wind up stealing his heart?Dixie and her friends, all school teachers from Arkansas, have endured wars and rumors of wars, true PMS, men problems, school problems, and shared the joys and sorrows of life for five years. Nothing could possibly destroy their friendship. But during the wonderfully hot summer, the very roots of the Sisterhood are shaken. Will it survive? Can Dixie and Boone find a future together? Is "happily ever after" a myth or does it really happen?
title: The PMS Club
